info.description: The PDF conversion API 'image2pdf' converts images to (searcheable) PDF files. The flow is generally as follows: 1. First upload an image using the /image2pdf POST endpoint. You will get back a response that contains a job with its associated settings. 2. Start the job from a PUT request to the /image2pdf/{jobid} endpoint, with the Job and Settings JSON as request body. The conversion to PDF will now start 3. Check the job status from the /image2pdf/{jobid} GET endpoint until the status has changed to DONE or ERROR. Messaging using a websocket will be available as an alternative in a future version 4. Retrieve the PDF file using the /image2pdf/{jobid}/stream GET endpoint. This will return the PDF file only when the status is DONE. In other cases it will return the Job Response JSON (with http code 202 instead of 200) Interactive testing: A web based test console is available in the Sphereon API Store
info.title: Sphereon :: DOC :: PDF

post.description: Upload an image for conversion to PDF. Conversion will not be started yet. In order to create a multipage PDF you can submit a multipage Tiff

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The binary image or PDF (file/inputstream) to convert to PDF

200.description: Image uploaded. A JSON Job response will be returned in the body.

get.description: Get the PDF job definition and current state. Please not that you can differentiate based on http response status

200.description: PDF job returned and Job is done or in error

202.description: PDF job returned and Job is still processing

put.description: Convert the previously uploaded image(s) to PDF, using the supplied settings associated with the job in the request body. You can only submit the job after a new Job is created with status IMAGE_UPLOADED or resubmit an existing Job with status ERROR. In all cases the job Id in the path must match the jobId in the request

400.description: Resubmitted job not allowed because the job is currently processing or already processed and had status DONE

delete.description: Delete the PDF job and all related files

200.description: PDF job returned and Job is done or in error

get.description:
Get the PDF as binary stream/file. Our API generation does not allow changing the media type based on the Accepted header unfortunately.
This means we use a seperate path postfix with the value '/stream'. This API only returns the PDF when the response status code is zero! In other cases nothing is returned or the Job JSON when it is still being executed

202.description: PDF not yet created. Job is still executing., Will return the JSON job instead of the PDF

404.description: Invalid job id. No response body is supplied

ocr.description: Whether to perform OCR. When set to false the text in the PDF will not be searchable

qualityFactor.description: Set the quality factor for the resulting PDF. Range from 0 (lowest) to 10 (highest)

level.description: Compression level. Valid range from 0 (minimal compression) to 10 (maximal compression)

type.description: Compression type. ADVANCED is only allowed and should be used with the ADVANCED engine

documentId.description: The document Id provided by a backend system

images.description: The names of the supplied images

queueId.description: The queue Id provided by a backend system

status.description: The status of the Ocr engine task itself

url.description: The URL on the bucketstore for the PDF. Only available once the status is DONE

actionTime.description: The time at which the job and files will be deleted, regardless of whether it has been retrieved or not. Maximal time is 1 day from job creation

Lifecycle.description: Lifecycle settings. When no lifecycle settings are supplied, the job and files will be deleted directly after retrieval of the file

jobId.description: The server generated job jobId. This jobId is checked against the jobId in the request path on overy invocation

PDFJob.description: The PDF job. Has access to the job settings.

completionTime.description: The completion date/time of this job in ISO 8601 format

creationTime.description: The creation date/time of this job in ISO 8601 format

images.description: The original images. Currently only a single image is supported. The image can be a multipage tiff however

queueTime.description: The conversion queue date/time of this job in ISO 8601 format

statusMessage.description: A status message, which can be informational, warning or error. AA message here does not indicate an error perse

updateTime.description: The last update date/time of this job in ISO 8601 format

PDFJobResponse.description: The PDF job. Has access to the job settings as well as ocr engine tasks
